meanings.definition: A person who sulks or is prone to sulking.
meanings.sent1: One of the sulkers in our group always pouts when things don't go their way.
meanings.sent2: The playground was filled with sulkers after the game was canceled due to rain.
meanings.sent3: The sulkers at the party made the atmosphere a bit gloomy.
meanings.sent4: The sulkers in the office cast a shadow over the team's morale.
meanings.sent5: The sulkers in the movie theater made it hard to enjoy the film.

meanings.sent1: The sulkers gathered in the corner, each wearing a frown.
meanings.sent2: I could see the sulkers sitting apart from the rest of the group.
meanings.sent3: The sulkers in the class formed a small clique of their own.
meanings.sent4: The sulkers on the bus seemed lost in their own thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The sulkers in the park seemed to blend into the shadows.
